attributes.title: Welcome to the Flarum Development Forum

attributes.contentHtml:
I've set up this forum as a place for any and all discussion related to Flarum's development. While a lot of discussion related to specific issues will probably take place on GitHub, this forum is a place for:

  • More general discussion about Flarum (feedback, philosophy, logistics, etc.)
  • Getting help with development (installation troubleshooting, questions about the architecture, etc.)

Also hit up our IRC channel: #flarum on irc.freenode.net.

For completeness' sake, here's a link to the Flarum repository on GitHub. Everything you need to know to get started is in the README.
It's not a good idea to remove comment (reply) field from the bottom of conversation. Button pressing for writing reply is not comfortable for main forum function

attributes.name: Blog
attributes.description: Official release announcements and other updates from the Flarum team.

attributes.name: Meta
attributes.description: Discussion about this community: its organisation and how we can improve it.

attributes.contentHtml:
I followed the instructions for installation and got through them without any issues, except when I try to load localhost after the last step, I get a blank white page and the following error message:

The exact line of code is:

```
var result = templateSpec.call(
```

I found a few things on StackOverflow talking about versions of handlebars vs ember, but everything looks good (I'm running handlebars 1.3.0, compiler revision 4). Any thoughts on what I might be missing? Thanks!
Can you expand the arrow to the left of the error message and paste the call stack here? There should be a line specific to Flarum's code which we can look at.
Btw, I got this resolved by using virtualenv. I think the versions of my various dependencies were throwing me off. Vagrant fixes this, too.

attributes.bio: Flarum founder and ex-lead developer. http://twitter.com/tobyzerner
Software Engineer based in Brisbane, Australia.

attributes.name: Support
attributes.description: Get help setting up, using, and customising Flarum.

attributes.contentHtml:
When it came to the part of the installation where I should input

" php artisan db:seed --class="Flarum\Core\Support\Seeders\DatabaseSeeder" "

The response that I get is

"PHP Fatal error: Class 'Faker\Factory' not found in /var/www/vendor/flarum/core/src/Flarum/Core/Support/Seeders/UserTableSeeder.php on line 18"

This should work:

```
cd vendor/flarum/core
composer install
```

Okay, so I ran composer install;

It installed several packages, then followed with this:

```
Generating autoload files
Could not open input file: artisan
Script php artisan config:publish flarum/core handling the post-install-cmd event returned with an error

[RuntimeException]
Error Output:

```
That shouldn't matter, did it fix your issue?
It did not. I still get the same PHP Fatal error.

OK, I think I understand what's going on now. Could you try:
1. Creating a folder called "workbench" in your Laravel app
2. Moving the "flarum" folder from "vendor" into "workbench"
3. Run php artisan dump-autoload

Okay, so I did that, then retried
```
php artisan db:seed --class="Flarum\Core\Support\Seeders\DatabaseSeeder"
```

Which now worked, do I leave it in workbench after that? or do I move it back?
Leave it in the workbench as it's the only way to properly load Flarum's dev dependencies. I'm going to update the README with new instructions.
Okay.. I suppose that makes sense.

Another errors raised after applying the same command

[Illuminate\Database\QueryException]

SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'flarumdb.config'

doesn't exist (SQL: truncate config)

[PDOException]

SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'flarumdb.config'

doesn't exist

I suspect you didn't run you migration command correctly.

Try php artisan migrate --bench="flarum/core" instead of php artisan migrate --package="flarum/core"

Here are the steps for setting up your DB from the beginning. After you have setup your L4 and workbench folders, run these commands

```
php artisan migrate --bench="flarum/core"
php artisan db:seed --class="Flarum\Core\Support\Seeders\DatabaseSeeder"
```

This should work for you.

Cheers!
ghosh Oops, missed this when updating the README. Fixed now!

Worked with me

All I have did wrong was that I did not put flarum folder into workbench folder from beginning, and fired the command "composer install"

thanks!

Awesome! I see you corrected the cd workbench/flarum/core/ember part too 😉

I was just about to open a PR, got stuck with the asset compilation..any ideas?
ghosh What do you mean?

@Toby Seems like the custom styles for flarum written in app.less is not getting compiled to css. Hence, the index.html references an empty flarum.css file resulting in a 404.

See - http://discuss.flarum.org/6-missing-flarum-css/0#p23

attributes.bio: Flarum founder and ex-lead developer. http://twitter.com/tobyzerner
Software Engineer based in Brisbane, Australia.

attributes.name: Support
attributes.description: Get help setting up, using, and customising Flarum.

attributes.contentHtml:
When I load my Flarum installation, I get a white page with nearly unformatted text that is all left-aligned, and opening the Developer tools shows that it is unable to get '/assets/flarum.css'
Now, I don't think I accidentally deleted it, as I don't recall deleting anything.

When I go exploring via sftp, I find the directory I believe to be the correct one
"/var/www/flarum/workbench/flarum/core/public/assets"
and there is in fact no flarum.css in there. Am I looking in the wrong place? I don't quite know why I'm getting an unstyled page.
Should be fixed in 24617b7e1e2d5fe5608ba5721672881f6a35e412. You'll need to run npm install in your ember directory. Let me know if it works?
That works..thanks.

attributes.name: Support
attributes.description: Get help setting up, using, and customising Flarum.

attributes.contentHtml:
So, I got the install to work -finally 🙂

But when I load it up, the ssh command line returns a bunch of JSHint Errors (35 to be exact) well, not exactly, it's throughout 35 different .js files, ranging 1-27 errors each

Probably as a result of the JS Errors, the some of the buttons on the site are 'dead'

But I will say, it looks very nice. Looking forward to a stable release in the future
JSHint errors are aesthetic only, they do not indicate any broken function. The buttons in the app are dead because they haven't been implemented yet. 😉
Okay. Good to know 🙂

attributes.contentHtml:
I translate the language packs into Chinese, include

  1. simplified Chinese
  2. traditional Chinese

https://github.com/justjavac/flarum-i18n-zh

Thank you for your enthusiasm. However, the language files you have translated are just placeholders and are not used in the application. Flarum is currently in heavy development and it will be months before it is ready to be translated. Please be patient!
@Toby Wish Flarum better than better
